Key Match Events: The Knicks led by as much as 14 points before the Thunder rallied to win 117-107.
The Thunder extended their winning streak to 14 games.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points for the Thunder.
Aaron Wiggins scored 15 points in the final period.
Isaiah Joe hit a three-pointer that gave the Thunder their first lead since the opening 24 minutes.
The Knicks were outscored 37-19 in the fourth quarter.
The Thunder outrebounded the Knicks 13-6 in the fourth quarter.
The Knicks were 1-of-9 from three-point range in the fourth quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Hart emphasized the need for the Knicks to keep going despite the loss.
Tom Thibodeau highlighted the importance of strong defense and readiness for the intensity of the fourth quarter.
Josh Hart stated that the team needs to execute better, especially in the fourth quarter.
